critique: This document primarily concerns the transfer of administrative control of certain properties in the Virgin Islands from naval authorities to the Department of Interior. It is an executive order from 1931. There is little to suggest a strong ideological tilt. It seems to be a matter of administrative organization. Immigration is not addressed. The transfer of control could be seen as a slight expansion of executive power, but it is more about managing existing territories. Federalism is implicated as it concerns federal control over territories. There is no clear indication of prioritizing national security over civil liberties or vice versa. Economic regulation is not a central theme. Social inclusion is not directly addressed.
